Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet Symbol Server] Gallery - Status Symbols" (#5977) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
UI changes for view the symbol status.
I couldn't get to this item. So the idea here is to show the status on the Package details page. We have the `LatestSymbolPackage` on the [DisplayPackageViewModel](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/dev/src/NuGetGallery/ViewModels/DisplayPackageViewModel.cs#L29). Show the status of this symbol package on the details page, like we show the indexing status.

- If the latest symbol package is validating, show the warning message as the symbol package is validating
- If the latest symbol package is deleted, show the error(may be warning?, check with @diverdan92) message as the symbol package is deleted.
- If the latest symbol package has failed validation, show the error message. And possibly show reason for failed validation, ask to reupload if necessary or contact support. 

You can get the appropriate messages from @diverdan92. Daniel would be able to clarify if need be.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Invalid cast exception in Header.cshtml" (#6268) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
timestamp [UTC] | 2018-08-05T04:57:59.8314587Z
-- | --
problemId | System.InvalidCastException at ASP._Page_Views_Shared_Gallery_Header_cshtml.Execute
type | System.InvalidCastException
assembly | App_Web_ci3hlftv, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null
method | ASP._Page_Views_Shared_Gallery_Header_cshtml.Execute

outerMethod | ASP._Page_Views_Shared_Gallery_Header_cshtml.Execute

```
exceptions
| where problemId == "System.InvalidCastException at ASP._Page_Views_Shared_Gallery_Header_cshtml.Execute"
```

The code sets it as a boolean.

```csharp
TempData["ShowPasswordDeprecationWarning"] = true;
```

But it is read as a string.

```csharp
Convert.ToBoolean((string)TempData["ShowPasswordDeprecationWarning"])
```

I think this works most of the time because TempData is serialized as a string... not sure though. This exception could perhaps happen if `TempData` is read in the same request as it is set. 

From this line:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/7f6ba8371c2aad0e6633c82fdb85c163eb58ed27/src/NuGetGallery/Views/Shared/Gallery/Header.cshtml#L4

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Signing out of NuGet.org does not sign me out of MSA login" (#5150) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Related to the current MSA/AAD/2FA work:

1. Sign in to NuGet.org using MSA account1
2. Sign out
3. Try to sign in to NuGet.org (hoping to sign in using another MSA account2)
4. You get signed in automatically with account1. You are never completely signed out.

Expected: 
1. Signing out should sign me out of NuGet.org account
2. On clicking 'Sign in' it should prompt me the MSA sign in screen.
3. If I enter the same account1 email address, the sign in should happen automatically as I was already signed in to MSA
4. If I use another MSA account2, I should be prompted for password and 2FA (if req) just like normal MSA sign in process.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Incorrect NuGet.config used during restore when running as LocalSystem" (#7299) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet Config files used:
    C:\Windows\system32\config\systemprofile\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config

Feeds used:
    https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json

However adding new sources to the config found at this path does not make them. They are added correctly, as they are visible when ru.

NuGet is adamant that 
C:\Windows\system32\config\systemprofile\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config
is the path of the config, but only sources added in C:\Windows\SysWOW64\config\systemprofile\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config result in the sources being included.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): NuGet.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 4.7.1.5393

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Windows Server 2012

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

When running nuget restore as the LocalSystem user, the incorrect config file is used. Nuget is adamant that it is using "C:\Windows\system32\config\systemprofile\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config", and this is what is displayed :

```
NuGet Config files used:
    C:\windows\system32\config\systemprofile\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config
```

But when adding sources to the config, they are not included in the restore.

It instead uses the config found at "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\config\systemprofile\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config"

Any sources added here are loaded, but nuget still says that it is using the other config.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "HttpHandlerResource has a HttpClientHandler property which is not available when using NSUrlSessionHandler on the Mac" (#7298) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

The [HttpHandlerResource](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/Resources/HttpHandlerResource.cs) has a HttpClientHandler property. A native HttpMessageHandler, which can be used by HttpClient, does not have to be a HttpClientHandler derived class. With Xamarin.Mac the native handler is [NSUrlSessionHandler](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/blob/master/src/Foundation/NSUrlSessionHandler.cs) which derives from HttpMessageHandler. The NSUrlSessionHandler cannot be used with the [HttpHandlerResourceV3](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/HttpSource/HttpHandlerResourceV3.cs) and a null value cannot be passed since there is a null check.

Searching the code it looks like the only place where this is used is in the [DownloadResourcePluginProvider](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/3803820961f4d61c06d07b179dab1d0439ec0d91/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/Providers/DownloadResourcePluginProvider.cs#L84) class where it is used to pass the HttpClientHandler.Proxy to the GetCredentialsRequestHandler. Is there another way we can handle this without requiring a HttpClientHandler as part of the HttpHandlerResource?

For now I can create a dummy HttpClientHandler - however if NuGet starts using the HttpClientHandler property for other things then this will likely not work if Visual Studio for Mac is using the NSUrlSessionHandler. Visual Studio for Mac can implement its own version of the HttpHandlerResourceV3Provider but having HttpHandlerResourceV3 require a HttpClientHandler is problematic here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""Failed to resolve all items referenced by '*.csproj' " warning shouldn't be raised when there are no Package/Project References" (#7297) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS UI
NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 4.8.1.5435 (latest stable)
VS version (if appropriate): 2017 (15.8.4) (latest stable)
OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Win10 v1803 (17134.228) (latest stable)
Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: Unknown

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
0. A solution which has a project using PackageReference for NuGet packages and another project without ProjectReferences and PackageReferences
1. Right click on the solution > execute "Restore NuGet packages"
2. Notice the first line in Package Manager output:
Failed to resolve all items referenced by '[...].csproj'. This message can typically be ignored. The issue may be resolved by fully restoring and building the solution. If the unresolved item is a project reference this can lead to an incomplete NuGet restore result and missing package references. To ensure that restore is able to find all projects verify that all projects are referenced correctly and exist on disk.

![reproduction screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13691489/45482139-836b1d00-b74d-11e8-9e71-d7fb77956ef8.png)

## Suggested things
Expected behavior: In this case, the message is confusing and implies that an action can be taken to resolve the warning. Since there is no problem resolving references, don't show this warning in this case.

### Sample Project
[Reproduction.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/2378737/Reproduction.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Invalid framework folder netstandard2.0" (#7296) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Please read the following information before posting the issue.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): NuGet

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Linux

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. GitLab CI script that uses a linux container image with nuGet installed as `apt install nuget`

2. Run the script

3. At the following step `nuget pack ./*NuGet/*.nuspec -Version $VERSION -OutputDirectory $NUGET_PACKAGE_FOLDER -Prop Configuration=Release -NoDefaultExcludes -Verbosity detailed` it creates the nuGet package but it issues a warning complaining about the framework not being valid.

...

## Other suggested things

The `.gitlab-ci.yml` with the commands
```
#Stages
stages:
  - ci
  - codequality
  - build
  - publish

#Global variables
variables:
  GIT_STRATEGY: $STRATEGY
  BUILD_NUMBER: $CI_PIPELINE_ID

#Jobs
ci:
  image: my-image.myrepo.com/gitlab-runner-nuget-dotnet-core:latest
  stage: ci
  script:
    - export VERSION=$(echo $(date +"%Y.%-m%d").$CI_PIPELINE_ID)
    - export NUGET_PACKAGE_FOLDER=nupkgs
    - dotnet build --configuration Release
    - dotnet vstest ./*Tests/bin/Release/**/*Tests.dll
    - mkdir $NUGET_PACKAGE_FOLDER
    - nuget pack ./*NuGet/*.nuspec -Version $VERSION -OutputDirectory $NUGET_PACKAGE_FOLDER -Prop Configuration=Release -NoDefaultExcludes -Verbosity detailed
    - cd $NUGET_PACKAGE_FOLDER
    - dotnet nuget push *.$VERSION.nupkg -s $ARTIFACTORY_NUGET_REPOSITORY
```

### Verbose Logs

```

If I set in my nuspec's file target a `lib/netcore`, for example, it does not complain, although it's not the framework I need to import the nuGet into a netstandard project.

netstandard
netstandard2.0
netstandard2_0
NETSTANDARD2_0

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.Protocol library does not use ConfigureAwait(false) which leads to deadlocks in NuGet plugins" (#7289) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

* NuGet version: 4.8.x
* dotnet CLI: 2.1.400+

When using `NuGet.Protocol` library for communication in NuGet plugins it could cause deadlocks in message processing on the plugin side and as result NuGet tasks fails with "was cancelled" messages like that:

```
[14:51:36][restore] Starting: C:\TeamCity\buildAgent\tools\NuGet.CommandLine.4.8.0-rtm.5369\tools\NuGet.exe restore C:\TeamCity\buildAgent\work\71412ac3a5525267\NuGetFeedTest.sln -NoCache -Verbosity detailed -Source http://localhost:8080/httpAuth/app/nuget/feed/_Root/default/v3/index.json -Source https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/
[14:51:36][restore] NuGet Version: 4.8.0.5369
[14:51:36][restore] MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '15.6.82.30579' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Community\MSBuild\15.0\bin'. Use option -MSBuildVersion to force nuget to use a specific version of MSBuild.
...
[14:51:37][restore] Restoring NuGet package NuGetFeedTest.0.0.314-beta.1.
[14:51:37][restore]   GET http://localhost:8080/httpAuth/app/nuget/feed/_Root/default/v3/flatcontainer/nugetfeedtest/0.0.314-beta.1/nugetfeedtest.0.0.314-beta.1.nupkg

[14:51:37][restore] Using C:\TeamCity\buildAgent\plugins\nuget-agent/bin/credential-plugin/net46/CredentialProvider.TeamCity.exe as a credential provider plugin.
[14:51:38][restore]   GET https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/Packages(Id='NuGetFeedTest',Version='0.0.314-beta.1')
[14:51:38][restore]   NotFound https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/Packages(Id='NuGetFeedTest',Version='0.0.314-beta.1') 161ms
[14:51:38][restore]   GET https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='NuGetFeedTest'&semVerLevel=2.0.0
[14:51:38][restore]   OK https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id='NuGetFeedTest'&semVerLevel=2.0.0 137ms
[14:51:42][restore] WARNING: Unable to find version '0.0.314-beta.1' of package 'NuGetFeedTest'.
[14:51:42][restore]   https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/: Package 'NuGetFeedTest.0.0.314-beta.1' is not found on source 'https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/'.
[14:51:42][restore]   http://localhost:8080/httpAuth/app/nuget/feed/_Root/default/v3/index.json: Getting package 'NuGetFeedTest.0.0.314-beta.1' from source 'http://localhost:8080/httpAuth/app/nuget/feed/_Root/default/v3/index.json' was cancelled.
[14:51:42][restore] 
[14:51:43][restore] WARNING: Unable to find version '0.0.314-beta.1' of package 'NuGetFeedTest'.
[14:51:43][restore]   https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/: Package 'NuGetFeedTest.0.0.314-beta.1' is not found on source 'https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/'.
[14:51:43][restore]   http://localhost:8080/httpAuth/app/nuget/feed/_Root/default/v3/index.json: Getting package 'NuGetFeedTest.0.0.314-beta.1' from source 'http://localhost:8080/httpAuth/app/nuget/feed/_Root/default/v3/index.json' was cancelled.
[14:51:43][restore] 
[14:51:43][restore] Errors in packages.config projects
[14:51:43][restore] 
[14:51:43][restore]     Unable to find version '0.0.314-beta.1' of package 'NuGetFeedTest'.
[14:51:43][restore]       https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/: Package 'NuGetFeedTest.0.0.314-beta.1' is not found on source 'https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/'.
[14:51:43][restore] NuGet Config files used:
[14:51:43][restore]     C:\Users\Dmitry.Tretyakov\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config
[14:51:43][restore]     C:\Program Files (x86)\NuGet\Config\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Offline.config
[14:51:43][restore]       http://localhost:8080/httpAuth/app/nuget/feed/_Root/default/v3/index.json: Getting package 'NuGetFeedTest.0.0.314-beta.1' from source 'http://localhost:8080/httpAuth/app/nuget/feed/_Root/default/v3/index.json' was cancelled.
[14:51:43][restore] 
[14:51:43][restore] Feeds used:
[14:51:43][restore]     http://localhost:8080/httpAuth/app/nuget/feed/_Root/default/v3/index.json
[14:51:43][restore]     https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/
[14:51:43][restore] Process exited with code 1
```

After adding `ConfigureAwait(false)` calls within `NuGet.Protocol` library this use case is unblocked and restore succeeds. Example: https://github.com/dtretyakov/NuGet.Client/commit/e2a50bd017852d30f8b4e771da8cc86f2144e93e

### Sample Project

The typical use cause is executing logging during message processing from NuGet:
https://github.com/JetBrains/teamcity-nuget-support/blob/master/nuget-extensions/nuget-plugin/PluginController.cs#L21-L27

Originally was reported in the https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6486#issuecomment-410250447

//cc @jainaashish, @nkolev92, @dtivel

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Test Failure]NuGet Client dev-ragrawal-4.0rtm\4.0.1.5492 failed to install into D15rtwsvc\26228.52" (#7295) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version:dev-ragrawal-4.0rtm\4.0.1.5492
VS version:D15rtwsvc\26228.52
OS version:Build 17134.rs4_release.180410-1804 
## Detailed repro steps
1. Install VS path: \\cpvsbuild\drops\VS\d15rtwsvc\products\26228.52\bootstrappers\Enterprise\vs_enterprise.exe
2. Install NuGet Client path:  \\ddfiles\Drops\NuGet\Drops\CI\NuGet.Client\dev-ragrawal-4.0rtm\4.0.1.5492\artifacts\VS15\NuGet.Tools.vsix
## Excepted
NuGet Client dev-ragrawal-4.0rtm\4.0.1.5492 should be installed into D15rtwsvc\26228.52 successfully.
## Actual
NuGet Client dev-ragrawal-4.0rtm\4.0.1.5492 failed to install into D15rtwsvc\26228.52 as below screenshot ( [Error log.txt](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/2374522/Error.log.txt)):
![installiation failed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40230425/45416364-534d4c80-b66f-11e8-9850-e4896e487f0c.png)
## Note
1. NuGet Manager disappeared after installing NuGet Client dev-ragrawal-4.0rtm\4.0.1.5492.
![no nuget manager](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40230425/45416380-59432d80-b66f-11e8-9831-36374d1421e6.png)
2. The issue reproes on D15rtwsvc\26228.54 after installing the same NuGet Client.
